text.name: system_description
text.text: Video System was a Japanese game developer and publisher founded by software designer Koji Furukawa, that operated between 1986-2004. They were initially known for developing Arcade games (mostly Mahjong sims) and would eventually produce games for other platforms, such as the Neo-Geo, SNES and Nintendo 64. They would go on to create the Aero Fighters, F-1 Grand Prix and Super Volley franchises.
